entry.et: Middle English, from Old English sala; akin to Old High German sala transfer, Old English sellan to sell sell

def.dt: :the act of selling
:the transfer of ownership of and title to property from one person to another for a price
:opportunity of selling or being sold :demand
:distribution by selling
:public disposal to the highest bidder :auction
:a selling of goods at bargain prices
:operations and activities involved in promoting and selling goods or services vice-president in charge of sales
:gross receipts
:available for purchase
:for sale
:available for purchase at a reduced price
city & port NW Morocco, N suburb of Rabat area pop 849,000
:a fund-raising event at which usually homemade foods (as cakes and cookies) are sold
:a formal instrument for the conveyance or transfer of title to goods and chattels
:a sale of merchandise damaged in a fire
:a sale at very low prices
:heavily discounted fire–sale prices
:a sale of used household or personal articles (as furniture, tools, or clothing) held on the seller's own premises
:rummage sale
:auction 1
:a usually informal sale of miscellaneous goods
:a sale of donated articles conducted by a nonprofit organization (as a church or charity) to help support its programs
